sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The color procedure is used to change the currently active color. This is the color of characters that are to be put on the screen. The alternate spelling is colour.
sections.text_content: The color procedure is used to change the currently active color. This is the color of characters that are to be put on the screen. The alternate spelling is colour.
sections.mdown_content: The **color** procedure is used to change the currently active color. This is the color of characters that are to be **put** on the screen. The alternate spelling is **colour**.

sections.title: Example
code:
setscreen ("graphics")
        for i : 1 .. 3
            color (i)
            put "Bravo"
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the message "Bravo" three times, each in a different color.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the message "Bravo" three times, each in a different color.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the message "Bravo" three times, each in a different color.

sections.title: Example
code:
setscreen ("graphics")
        const message := "Happy New Year!!"
        for i : 1 .. length (message)
            color (i  mod maxcolor + 1)
            put message (i) ..
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out a message. The color of each letter is different from the preceding letter. For letter number i the color number is i mod maxcolor + 1. This cycles repeatedly through all the available colors.
sections.text_content: This program prints out a message. The color of each letter is different from the preceding letter. For letter number i the color number is i mod maxcolor + 1. This cycles repeatedly through all the available colors.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out a message. The color of each letter is different from the preceding letter. For letter number _i_ the color number is _i_ mod maxcolor + 1. This cycles repeatedly through all the available colors.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
See maxcolor for the number of colors available in the various "graphics" modes. The background color that text appears upon can be set using the colorback procedure.

The screen must be in a "graphics" mode to use the color procedure. See setscreen for details.
sections.text_content:
See maxcolor for the number of colors available in the various "graphics" modes. The background color that text appears upon can be set using the colorback procedure.
The screen must be in a "graphics" mode to use the color procedure. See setscreen for details.
sections.mdown_content:
See **maxcolor** for the number of colors available in the various "_graphics_" modes. The background color that text appears upon can be set using the **colorback** procedure.
The screen must be in a "_graphics_" mode to use the **color** procedure. See **setscreen** for details.
